channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for CA
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for CA

Upon inspection we found about 1liter of brake cleaner had leaked out. all clean up material was kept with package. DescribePack: Package was punctured on the underside of the steel drum. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package was place in a hazmat bag and tote.

item.title: Report E-2024020475
item.description:
Report E-2024020475

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-26T15:11:07+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-21
  • City: BAKERSFIELD
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS FREIGHT, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: XPO notified ERTS regarding (2) ripped bags of hazardous product. As a result of improper loading, two bags containing corrosive material were torn and released approximately 2-cups of product onto the wooden trailer floor. A Contractor clean-up the release and containerized the damaged product into one drum for waste disposal. No storm-drains, waterways, or soil were affected.

item.title: Report X-2024021077
item.description:

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-13
  • City: VAN NUYS
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: RESPONDED TO (2) PACKAGES THAT WERE COLD TO THE TOUCH WITH FROST FORMING ON THE OUTER BOXES. UPON INSPECTION OF THE CONTENTS DISCOVERED APPROXIMATELY ONE POUND OF DRY ICE PELLETS COOLING ICE CREAM. THERE ARE NO DANGEROUS GOODS MARKS OR LABELS ON THE OUTER BOXES. ADDITIONAL TRACKING NUMBER TO ANOTHER CONSIGNEE IS 1ZG9244R1319168103. THESE PACKAGES HAVE NOT BEEN ACCEPTED FOR AIR OR TRANSPORTED IN THE AIR BY UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO.

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: There was a call from the load side for a leaking hazmat. QA arrived on the scene and noticed the package was slightly damp and there was some moisture where the package had been sitting for a few minutes. Absorbant was placed over the wet area, and the package was placed in a tote lined with a bag. DescribePack: There was a defect in one of the caps which caused a slow leak. DurationRel: 0 and MitigateEffect: Absorbant was placed over the affected area.

item.title: Report E-2024020388
item.description:
Report E-2024020388

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-21T15:11:40+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-08
  • City: W SACRAMENTO
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On February 8, 2024, one (1) 5-gallon pail of UN1263 was damaged due to a load shift and released approximately one (1) gallon of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Patriot Environmental Services (PES) to remediate the impacted site. Crews deployed granular absorbents to the impacted area and worked them in with hand tools. Cleaners and absorbent pads were utilized to remove any residual product. The damaged pail, all UN1263 impacted materials, and spent absorbents were collected and containerized into one (1) 55-gallon drum for disposal

item.title: Report X-2024021025
item.description:
Report X-2024021025

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-21T15:11:40+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-09
  • City: NEWARK
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: 1. X-2024021025 SequenceEvent: Package was located inside the trailer and smoke was coming from it I was called to retrieve the package and inspected, package was wet and when inspected it was found that the bottle was leaking from the bottom. DescribePack: bottle was cracked at the bottom. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: PPE was brought to contain the package in a hazmat bag and a tote after I cleaned the area and took another package that was leaked on or damage. 2. X-2024021114 SequenceEvent: Three of twenty identical HazMat packages were reported leaking when being unloaded at station. Of the seventeen that were assessed and determined to be unaffected and sent OFD, two more developed leaks in transit, affecting in all ten packages. These packages were transferred from the van they were on to be brought back to station for processing, along with the other seven, refused by recipient due to exposure to the leakage incident. DescribePack: Internal bottle cracked at edge of base. Crack was visually about a half inch in length, though it was only leaking from a section of the crack. DurationRel: 3 and MitigateEffect: Affected packages were removed from original van and returned to station. Unknown what other packages were aboard van that continued on its route. 3. X-2024021226 SequenceEvent: Package was inside the trailer wet and was called for an inspection and was found that one of the bottles was leaking from the bottom as it was cracked. DescribePack: Small crack at the bottom of the bottle. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package was put into a hazmat bag and a tote and then taken into the hazmat area as well as the area where the leak happened was cleaned up.

TOOK IT TO THE HAZMAT CAGE. DescribePack: THE GALLONS HAD LOSE CAPS AND DIDNT HAD ENOUGH PAPER, POPCORN OR BUBBLE WRAP. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: THE PACKAGE WAS PUT IN A HAZMAT BAG AND INTO THE HAZMAT DISPOSABLE BIN. TOOK IT TO THE HAZMAT CAGE.

item.title: Report X-2024020769
item.description:
Report X-2024020769

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-27T18:13:01+00:00

  • City: CARSON

  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package came back to the station after delivery attempt was made. Vehicle was brought in so picked up packages can be unloaded and the package was in the corner of the truck with the contents visibly spilled. Using proper PPE, absorbent was used to clean up the spill inside the vehicle, and on the dock floor. Damaged package was placed in a HazMat tote, along with the absorbent that was used to clean up the spill that was placed in a separate HazMat tote DescribePack: 2 out of the 4 gallon bottles with cracked caps, causing internal leakage inside of package. DurationRel: 5 and MitigateEffect: Proper PPE was used to clean up the spill. Gloves and Absorbent was placed inside of the vehicle and also placed on the dock floor. Absorbent was then cleaned up and placed in a separate HazMat tote

  • Description: A can of flammable liquid had fell over off the belt loader unto the ground and the spill surrounded the Power Stow belt loader.
